guide.introduction: I have a bunch of great logo tee-shirts but they're cut for men and I don't like the way they fit, so today I'm going to show you how to mod your t-shirts into a flattering shape that you'll actually wear.
guide.introduction_rendered:
I have a bunch of great logo tee-shirts but they're cut for men and I don't like the way they fit, so today I'm going to show you how to mod your t-shirts into a flattering shape that you'll actually wear.

Relevant parts
  • Unisex t-shirt
  • Well-fitting ladies t-shirt
Tools
  • Scissors
  • Serger
  • Sewing pins
  • Tailor's chalk

lines.text: First, iron your shirts and turn them inside-out.
lines.text_raw: First, iron your shirts and turn them inside-out.

lines.text: Line up the template at the shoulders and trace around it with tailor's chalk.
lines.text_raw: Line up the template at the shoulders and trace around it with tailor's chalk.

lines.text: Pin along the new side seams, and cut off the sleeves at the new armhole.
lines.text_raw: Pin along the new side seams, and cut off the sleeves at the new armhole.

lines.text: Run the new side seams through the serger.
lines.text_raw: Run the new side seams through the serger.

lines.text: Lay out the old sleeve under the template t-shirt and mark the new underarm and armhole.
lines.text_raw: Lay out the old sleeve under the template t-shirt and mark the new underarm and armhole.

lines.text: Serge the underarm, then cut the shoulder curve.
lines.text_raw: Serge the underarm, then cut the shoulder curve.

lines.text: Flip the sleeve right side out and set it inside the armhole of the shirt.
lines.text_raw: Flip the sleeve right side out and set it inside the armhole of the shirt.

lines.text: Pin both sleeves into their armholes.
lines.text_raw: Pin both sleeves into their armholes.

lines.text: Serge the sleeve seams and you're all done!
lines.text_raw: Serge the sleeve seams and you're all done!

guide.title: T-Shirt Mod: Boxy to Foxy
